Parameters: String: the list of jar/apk files containing classes and resources, delimited by File.pathSeparator, which defaults to ":" on Android
PathClassLoader(java.lang.String,java.la.Description: Creates a PathClassLoader that operates on a given list of files and directories. This method is equivalent to calling @B_dalvik#system#PathClassLoader#PathClassLoader_E@ with a null value for the second argument (see description there).

Parameters: String: the list of jar/apk files containing classes and resources, delimited by File.pathSeparator, which defaults to ":" on Android
String: the list of directories containing native libraries, delimited by File.pathSeparator; may be null
PathClassLoader(java.lang.String,java.la.Description: Creates a PathClassLoader that operates on two given lists of files and directories. The entries of the first list should be one of the following: JAR/ZIP/APK files, possibly containing a "classes.dex" file as well as arbitrary resources. Raw ".dex" files (not inside a zip file). The entries of the second list should be directories containing native library files.
PathClassLoader(java.lang.String,java.la.FullName: public PathClassLoader (String dexPath, String librarySearchPath, ClassLoader parent)

ClassDesc: Provides a simple @B_java#lang#ClassLoader_E@ implementation that operates on a list of files and directories in the local file system, but does not attempt to load classes from the network. Android uses this class for its system class loader and for its application class loader(s).
